title: Deploy approved Draft Version 36 to production

requirements.text: Deploy the current approved build (Draft Version 36) to production as an Internet Computer canister upgrade, without making further feature/code changes.
acceptanceCriteria: A production deployment is performed using the current codebase corresponding to Draft Version 36.
The canister upgrade completes successfully (no traps during preupgrade/postupgrade, if applicable).
The production frontend loads and connects to the production backend canister successfully.

requirements.text: After production deployment, perform a basic smoke test of the critical flows mentioned in the latest iteration: Internet Identity login/logout behavior and user profile persistence across refresh/relogin.

quotes: does the updated version feel closer to what you needed, especially around profile persistence and login behavior?

acceptanceCriteria: A user can sign in via Internet Identity and reach protected routes (e.g., Dashboard).
A user can update their profile and the changes persist after a full page refresh.
A user can log out and log back in and still see their persisted profile data.
No new runtime errors are observed in the UI during the smoke test.

constraints: Do not edit files under frontend/src/components/ui or any other frontend immutable paths listed in SYSTEM_CONTEXT.
nonGoals: Implement new features or UI redesigns.
Refactor backend/frontend architecture beyond what is required to deploy the already-approved build.
